questions.question: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Yellow diamond-shaped signs are used to warn motorists of potential hazards.

questions.question: What does a red octagon-shaped sign mean?
questions.explanation: A red octagon-shaped sign is universally recognized as a stop sign.

questions.question: What does a green traffic light mean?
questions.explanation: A green light means you can go if the way is clear.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at an intersection with no crosswalks?
questions.explanation: At intersections without crosswalks, vehicles have the right-of-way over pedestrians.

questions.question: When two vehicles arrive at a four-way stop at the same time, who has the right of way?
options: The vehicle that is traveling faster
Both vehicles at the same time
questions.explanation: The general rule is that you must yield to the vehicle on the right at a four-way stop.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit on a rural interstate highway in Arkansas?
questions.explanation: The maximum speed limit on a rural interstate highway in Arkansas is 75 mph.

questions.question: When is it safe to exceed the speed limit?
questions.explanation: It is never safe or legal to exceed the speed limit.

questions.question: Where is it illegal to park in Arkansas?
options: In a handicapped space without a permit
Within 15 feet of a fire hydrant
questions.explanation: All of these parking behaviors are illegal in Arkansas.

questions.question: When parked on a hill, you should turn your wheels...
options: Away from the curb when facing uphill
Towards the curb when facing uphill
Away from the curb when facing downhill
questions.correctAnswer: Away from the curb when facing uphill
questions.explanation: When parked facing uphill, turn your wheels away from the curb.

questions.question: In poor visibility conditions, you should...
questions.explanation: In poor visibility conditions such as fog, use your low beams to prevent light reflection.
